name: A-20
effect:
Each of your skill cards is destiny +2.
Are you busy? I’m looking for someone that would play with me.

name: Acerola
effect:
When your PC wins a fight, you may discard a card.
I feel like my connection is slow. I guess it’s time for me to upgrade to a rocket or linear connection.

name: Armor Shogun
effect:
Storable—may attack when your knife attacks.
Its double-bladed attack is formidable.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 knives.
Reward: Log out your PC to wound a PC.

name: Bom-ba-ye
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent places 4 cards from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.
The name means “do it!” or “beat him up!”
To Play/To Flip: Remove 5 monsters in your discard pile from the game OR sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Bone Army
effect:
Place 3 cards from your discard pile on top of your deck.
An army of bones makes a skeleton walk.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness].

name: Bottomless, Hopeless, Footstep
effect:
When a winning [Wood] monster is about to be placed in the discard pile, its owner may place it in his or her portal instead.
According to the Board, Level 10 Vine is located here... Seems like a hoax, though....

name: Brb
effect:
Log out a PC.
Chat slang for “be right back.” Used by players with “real life” problems, like making dinner or answering the phone.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Wood] [Wood].

name: Byakuen
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may draw a card.
A flaming, stabbing sword.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Cadet Valkyrie
effect:
Storable—may attack when your amazon attacks.
She’s still in training.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Log out a PC.

name: Cedar Wand
effect:
When you play this item, log out its bearer.
Many woods have magical properties.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Collapsed, Pagan, Remains
effect:
Each [Earth] monster is destiny +1.
According to the Board thread, Trading Convention will be held at B1 floor of the dungeon.

name: Crab Turtle
effect:
It’s a rather peculiar creature of the sea.
To Play/To Flip: Remove a [Water] monster from your discard pile. Play it as a hidden card.
Reward: No reward.

name: Crest
effect:
When you play an item, you may heal its bearer.
Noise and server crashes. “The World” is very honest. I hope it gets fixed soon.

name: Cubia
effect:
A huge, dangerous creature with its own army of followers.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 7 gomora.
Reward: Shuffle your discard pile into your deck.

name: Cursed Blade
effect:
The misfortune travels from the weapon to the victim.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 5 knives.
Reward: Log out your PC to play a card.

name: Dalaigon
effect:
Its flaming breath can ravage a whole field.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 9 of your monsters.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a lizard, destroy up to 5 hidden cards.

name: Dalaigon Anecdote
effect:
A seldom-seen, more powerful version of the deadly Dalaigon.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 11 of your monsters.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a lizard, wound every PC.

name: Dark Dance
effect:
Give that Twin Blade strength +1 for each wounded PC you can spot.
Continuous slash at high speed with blades in darkness.
To Play/To Flip: Your Twin Blade must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Dark History
effect:
When you play this item, you may assign to it the game text of an item you can spot. This effect lasts until the end of the turn.
It has an evil past.
To Play/To Flip: Discard 4 cards, each of a different element OR sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Dark Horse
effect:
Thunder and darkness make it seem to turn at right angles.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].
Reward: Wound a PC.

name: Darkness Axe
effect:
When you play this item, you may reveal the top 3 cards of your opponent’s deck and place one of them in his or her discard pile.
It harnesses a powerful area attack spell.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Death Crane
effect:
This bird is strength +1 for each of your logged out cards.
To Play/To Flip: Log out 3 of your PCs.
Reward: Log in a card and play a monster from your discard pile to your portal. This monster need not be storable.

name: Demonic Sword
effect:
When you play this item, you may destroy a card whose element opposes one of bearer’s elements.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 3 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Disco Knife
effect:
Storable—may attack when your knife attacks.
Don’t dance too close to the edges.
To Play/To Flip: No requirements.
Reward: Log out your PC to draw a card.

name: Dogman's Sword
effect:
On your opponent’s next turn following the play of this item, he or she cannot play monsters.
Strong sword for an experienced Blademaster.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] [Darkness] OR sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Dolorous, Evil Eyed, Widow
effect:
When a [Water] monster wins a fight, an additional monster from that fight can be scored.
Area posted on the Board where the girl-like figure was witnessed.

name: Downer Gomora
effect:
Storable—may attack when your gomora attacks. If this gomora loses a fight, you may assign it to an unresolved fight.
Always a depressing sight to behold.
To Play/To Flip: Discard or sacrifice a card.
Reward: No reward.

name: Dust Curse
effect:
Storable—may attack when your knife attacks.
It’s a terror from the ancient past.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 of the same element.
Reward: Log out your PC to play a hidden card.

name: Earth Axe
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may play a weapon to return this item to your hand.
Strike like a landslide.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Earthian Sword
effect:
The power of earth is restoring and eternal.
To Play/To Flip: Place 4 [Fire] cards from your discard pile on top of your deck OR sacrifice a lv. 2 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Blade.

name: Elf Haven
effect:
Reveal all of your hidden cards. You may play any items revealed.
Up to 99 different types of items can be stored.
To Play/To Flip: Play a hidden card.

name: Faded Reminders
effect:
Each player removes the top 5 cards of his or her deck from the game.
Sheraton lost his body on the outside.
To Play/To Flip: A card must have just been placed on top of a deck.

name: Fateful Encounter
effect:
Return up to 2 of your cards in play to your hand. Then play that many hidden cards.
A simple treasure chest changed Tsukasa’s life both inside and outside “The World.”
To Play/To Flip: You must have just played a Wavemaster.

name: Fire Helm
effect:
When you play this item, you may place up to 2 [Fire] cards from your discard pile on top of your deck.
Worn by many heavy axemen.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 1 helm on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster, Twin Blade, or Long Arm.

name: Fishskin
effect:
Scale and fin make a razor-sharp edge.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 3 weapon on bearer to your hand. Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Franken
effect:
Storable—may attack when your ghost or undead attacks. This undead draws an additional destiny for each other monster in its fight.
To Play/To Flip: Discard or sacrifice a ghost or undead.
Reward: Sacrifice a monster to perform its reward.

name: Fresh Valkyrie
effect:
On the turn this amazon attacks, a monster in your portal may attack, and must fight the same PC as this amazon.
She wants to take you home.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Wood] [Wood] [Wood].
Reward: No reward.

name: Fugaku
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may destroy a monster in your portal.
A heavy one-handed sword.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Gan Basher
effect:
Give that Heavy Axeman strength +1 for each item he or she bears.
Swing the axe. Range increases with level.
To Play/To Flip: Your Heavy Axeman must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Gate Out
effect:
If that PC wins the fight, log out a PC.
Tsukasa can go anywhere, except home.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Wood]. Your PC must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Goblin Boots
effect:
When you play this item, you may play a goblin or goblin item.
Didn’t think you would get this far gob.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Goblin Cap
effect:
You did better than I thought. My bad for underestimating you. But don’t get cocky.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Goblin Gloves
effect:
When you play this item, you may place a goblin or goblin item from your discard pile on top of your deck.
Playing tag with me is not a game anymore.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Goblin Mail
effect:
When you play this item, you may play a storable goblin from your discard pile to your portal.
I can’t believe I lost.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Goblin Tag
effect:
Play a goblin or goblin item from your discard pile.
Let’s play tag. If you win, I’ll give you a reward. I really doubt that will happen, though.
To Play/To Flip: Spot a goblin.

name: Grand Armor
effect:
When your PC logs in, you may play this armor on that PC without returning a lv. 1 armor to your hand.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 1 armor on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster, Twin Blade, or Long Arm.

name: Grand Electric
effect:
On the turn this wizard attacks, each other monster is strength +1.
He is a master of lightning magic.
To Play/To Flip: Remove 8 [Thunder] cards in your discard pile from the game.
Reward: No reward.

name: Grand Mage
effect:
On the turn this wizard attacks, actions cannot be flipped.
He can paralyze you with fear.
To Play/To Flip: Remove 4 [Fire] cards in your discard pile from the game.
Reward: No reward.

name: Great Elite
effect:
A powerful and rare wand, imbued with strong summon magics.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 3 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Wavemaster.

name: Great Sled Dog
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may draw a card.
Its flaming breath vaporizes water instantly.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Water] card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Water] card.

name: Green Wyrm
effect:
Worse than the red ones.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 5 monsters in your portal.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a lizard, log out every item.

name: Headhunt Lord
effect:
On the turn you play Headhunt Lord, no other monster can attack.
Overseer of the unliving.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 3 wounded PCs.
Reward: Wound up to 2 PCs.

name: Headless King
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may wound a PC.
He seems to like the heads with the skin removed.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Thunder] card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Thunder] card.

name: Hirameki
effect:
Give that Blademaster strength +1 for each action you flip during this fight.
Quick draw attack dicing the opponent in a flash.
To Play/To Flip: Your Blademaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Holy Tree Mail
effect:
When you play this item, you may play an item from your discard pile.
Holy trees repel witches. So they say.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 2 armor on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.

name: Innis
effect:
Phase: 2 – The Mirage of Deceit
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 pairs of cards, each containing opposing elements.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices 2 cards of opposing elements. If this is not possible, opponent sacrifices 2 cards.

name: Ironball Mania
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may play an item.
Some think it’s a magnetic monster.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Wood] card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Wood] card.

name: Ironball Titan
effect:
Its destructiveness is legendary.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 3 goblins.
Reward: Remove up to 2 goblins in your discard pile from the game to perform their rewards.

name: Key Axe
effect:
When you play this item, you may log in all cards.
Panta will trade you one for an Ice Bar.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 3 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Heavy Axeman.

name: Kill Gomora
effect:
Storable—may attack when your gomora attacks.
The deadliest of the species.
To Play/To Flip: Discard or sacrifice a monster.
Reward: Make a gomora strength +3 for the rest of the turn.

name: Killer Snaker
effect:
Storable—may attack when your snake or lizard attacks.
Its venom is very deadly.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 4 monsters.
Reward: Log in up to 3 cards.

name: King Snakoid
effect:
On the turn this lizard attacks, each [Fire] monster in your portal may attack.
Not an elected position.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 9 monsters.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a lizard, destroy a monster.

name: Lambada Knife
effect:
Storable—may attack when your knife attacks.
It’s forbidden.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 3 of the same element.
Reward: Log out your PC to destroy an item.

name: Lamia Fighter
effect:
Storable—may attack when your snake or lizard attacks.
Slithering vampires are the worst kind.
To Play/To Flip: Spot a monster.
Reward: Log in a card.

name: Lamia Hunter
effect:
She’s looking for victims, and she’s not too picky.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth].
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a monster in his or her portal.

name: Lead Snakoid
effect:
On the turn this lizard attacks, each snake and lizard in your portal may attack.
Its way of combat uses two weapons.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 monsters.
Reward: Spot your [Fire] card and place it on top of your deck.

name: Let Us Walk Together
effect:
Play up to 2 cards (except monsters).
I’ve been waiting for you for such a long time.
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must have just logged in.

name: Lightless, Distant, Dead Lands
effect:
When a monster is played, its owner may sacrifice any number of [Fire] monsters. For the rest of the turn, the played monster is strength +2 for each monster sacrificed.
Nuke Usagimaru’s Show will be shown.

name: Loss Of Signal
effect:
Each player draws destiny. If your destiny is greater, return a PC and all cards on him or her to their owners’ hands.
Sometimes it’s not an accident.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 hidden cards.

name: Magus
effect:
A PC that loses a fight to Magus is destroyed.
Phase: 3 – The Propagation
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 3 PCs, each healthy and bearing a weapon and armor.
Reward: No reward.

name: Magus Leaf
effect:
Storable—may attack when your phase attacks.
Kill them quickly or they explode like bombs.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 monsters in your portal.
Reward: Log out a PC.

name: Marlo
effect:
When you draw destiny for your PC, if that destiny card is a storable monster, you may play it.
Don’t wander too far ahead. You’re weak, you know.

name: Mere Memories
effect:
Each player sacrifices an item from each of his or her PCs.
Jinn is a failed character, wandering the network.
To Play/To Flip: A unique monster must have just been sacrificed or destroyed.

name: Merman Spear
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may score a hidden monster.
You might meet a merman with the same name as you.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Long Arm.

name: Merue Zot
effect:
Give that Wavemaster strength +1 for each of your healthy PCs.
Raise ice columns below the target.
To Play/To Flip: Your Wavemaster must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Metal Emperor
effect:
Storable—may attack when your golem attacks.
A living creature made from metal parts.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a card.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. You may play this card.

name: Metal Eraser
effect:
Reveal the top 2 cards of your deck. You may play one of them.
This contraption can end your game. A recent save may be your only defense.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 cards.

name: Micino
effect:
Micino is strength +2 when fighting multiple monsters.
Do you want to trade?

name: Monsieur
effect:
Draw 2 cards. You may then play an item.
Did you lose a Golden Axe? Or was it a Silver Axe?

name: Moonstone
effect:
If Moonstone is healthy when you draw destiny, you may wound him to redraw that destiny.
I must become... stronger.

name: Mummy Ripper
effect:
Storable—may attack when your amazon attacks.
Her claws can rip a hole in the portal itself.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Wood] [Wood].
Reward: Play a [Wood] monster to your portal. This monster need not be storable.

name: Mummy Scissors
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may play a storable monster to his or her portal.
These sharp blades can cut many things.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Earth] card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Earth] card.

name: Newt Necklace
effect:
When you play this item, you may return up to 3 hidden cards to their owners’ hands.
Can provide valuable healing spells.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer may be any PC.

name: Nobunaga Soul
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may play a card.
Named for a great feudal lord.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a [Darkness] card.
Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Darkness] card.

name: Nuke Usagimaru
effect:
When Nuke Usagimaru wins a fight, you may reveal your opponent’s hand and discard a revealed card.
Don’t hate me because I’m beautiful.

name: Orchid Dance
effect:
If that Twin Blade wins the fight, your opponent sacrifices an elemental card.
Strong, lv. 2 wood-based attack.
To Play/To Flip: Your Twin Blade must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Orochi
effect:
Opponent sacrifices 2 monsters in his or her portal.
Its physical attack is more effective than magic.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth] [Earth].

name: Phalanx
effect:
Opponent places 6 cards from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.
Its mace is like a torrent of spikes.
To Play/To Flip: Spot [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder] [Thunder].

name: Pvp
effect:
Place a [Fire] card from your hand on top of your deck.
Player vs. player is not allowed in later versions of “The World.”
To Play/To Flip: Your PC must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Rachel
effect:
When you flip an action, you may spot its opposing element to destroy a hidden card.
Since we’re here, I’ll accept a gift.

name: Raging, Forbidden, March
effect:
When a fight involving a [Thunder] monster is resolved, add 1 to the lowest destiny drawn.
The Gott Statue has a Silver Scarab and a Priest Stole.

name: Rai Wipe
effect:
Duplicate that Long Arm’s game text this turn.
Wide-ranging electric-based attack.
To Play/To Flip: Your Long Arm must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Rairaku
effect:
Give that Heavy Blade strength +1 for each monster in the fight.
Powerful attack above and below the waist.
To Play/To Flip: Your Heavy Blade must be in a fight. You must flip this card before drawing destiny.

name: Red Wyrm
effect:
Storable.
Not as bad as the green ones.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 monsters.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a lizard, destroy a hidden card.

name: Repth Gomora
effect:
Storable—may attack when your gomora attacks.
Uses magic spells to heal other gomora.

Reward: For the rest of the turn, you may score each of your gomora that wins a fight.

name: Ryokugan
effect:
When you play this item, your opponent may play a storable monster to his or her portal.
To Play/To Flip: Bearer must be a Twin Blade.

name: Sanjuro
effect:
Sanjuro is strength +2 when fighting an opposing element.
If you got swords, give them to me, all right?

name: Scorpioid
effect:
Watch out for the stinger... and the wheels.
To Play/To Flip: Remove 4 [Water] monsters from your discard pile. Play them as hidden cards.
Reward: No reward.

name: Setback
effect:
Opponent places 4 cards from his or her discard pile under his or her deck.
Even heroes encounter difficulties.

name: Shapeless, Haunted, Holy Ground
effect:
When a [Darkness] monster attacks, its owner may place the top 2 cards of his or her deck in his or her discard pile.
Area written in Piros’ email. The cat that made him suffer is here.

name: Shield Devil
effect:
Place 3 cards from the top of your deck in your discard pile.
It hides behind a fearsome mask.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 2 wounded PCs.

name: Shield Man
effect:
Storable—may attack when your demon attacks.
Place 2 cards from the top of your deck in your discard pile.
To Play/To Flip: Spot a wounded PC.

name: Smiley Ray
effect:
You won’t be smiley when it’s done with you.
To Play/To Flip: Spot 6 hidden cards.
Reward: Heal a PC.

name: Snakoid
effect:
Storable.
The snake that walks like a man.

Reward: Place a [Fire] card from your hand on top of your deck.

name: Snip Snap
effect:
Storable—may attack when your crustacean attacks.

name: Snow Panther
effect:
When you play this item, you may return an item on your PC to your hand.
Stylish leg armor that boosts physical defense.

name: Speed Charm
effect:
You may play an additional card this turn for each card sacrificed. You cannot play monsters for the rest of this turn.
Temporary increase in movement speed.

name: Star Fish
effect:
When you play this monster, your opponent may play an action.
It’s not a starfish, it’s a star fish.

Reward: Opponent sacrifices a [Fire] card.

name: Starving Ogre
effect:
Seems like he’s always hungry.

Reward: Play up to 2 storable goblins from your discard pile to your portal.

name: Statue Menhir
effect:
On the turn this idol attacks, up to 2 monsters in your portal may attack.
It likes to help other monsters.

name: Sudden Reversal
effect:
Opponent redraws that destiny.

name: Summon Goblin
effect:
Play a goblin from your discard pile and ignore its “To Play” requirements. For the rest of the turn, you may score an additional goblin from each fight.

name: Super Wufei
effect:
When you play this item, destroy all of your hidden cards.
Annri will trade you one for Chinese Food.

name: Switch
effect:
Switch the assignment of 2 assigned monsters.
A new perspective can be helpful.

name: Sword
effect:
Ask a witch how to get one.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice a lv. 3 weapon on bearer. Bearer must be a Blademaster.

name: Sword Of Chaos
effect:
Storable—may attack when your knife attacks.

To Play/To Flip: No requirements.

name: System Administrator
effect:
Each player removes all cards in his or her discard pile from the game.
Your character violates the software usage agreement. I will delete you now.

name: Terajima Ryoko
effect:
Terajima Ryoko provides an additional occurrence of each element on each item she bears.
Because of you, I no longer get lost.

name: Terror Of Death
effect:

name: Thunder Armor
effect:
When you play this item, all cards in each player’s hand are removed from the game.
No one is immune to the effects of thunder.

name: Treeman Spear
effect:
It’s the wielder that has the battle madness.

name: Tsukasa
effect:
Tsukasa cannot log out. If Tsukasa is healthy, you may wound him to return a storable monster he is fighting to its owner’s hand.
Why am I the only one like this? There’s no way for me to get out of here.

name: Tsukasa's Guardian
effect:
“The World” provides Tsukasa with power and safety that real life could not.

name: Unexpected Arrival
effect:
Log in up to 2 cards.

name: Vak Wipe
effect:
Give that Long Arm strength +1 for each species you can spot amongst attacking monsters.

name: Valkyrie
effect:
On the turn this amazon attacks, a monster in your portal may attack, and must fight the same PC as this amazon.
She will escort you to the gods of Valhalla.

Reward: Log out a PC.

name: Varias Gomora
effect:
Storable—may attack when your gomora attacks.
It mysteriously hovers, and then attacks.
To Play/To Flip: Discard or sacrifice an item.
Reward: Play a gomora. You may assign it to a unresolved fight.

name: Voodoo Goblin
effect:
Capable of conjuring fire out of thin air.
To Play/To Flip: Sacrifice 2 goblins.
Reward: Draw 2 cards.

name: Wiseman
effect:
When your PC logs in, you may take a card from your discard pile into hand.
Now then, what can I do for you?

name: Wyrm Scale
effect:
When your opponent draws destiny, you may play this item and make him or her redraw that destiny.
Magical armor made from lizard skin.
To Play/To Flip: Return a lv. 1 armor on bearer to your hand. Bearer may be any PC except a Wavemaster.
